messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Joly, Boxer, Mosle
messages.msgSnippet: Dale, Thanks - probably much easier than making them into web documents.  Barry is on the list, so we ll see what he wants to do. I checked with Alan Harvie
messages.messageBody:
Dale,
Thanks - probably much easier than making them into web documents. Barry is on the list, so we'll see what he wants to do.

I checked with Alan Harvie who has been publishing a lot of vintage material in the Northern California club newsletter to make sure that he wasn't already working on it (he isn't). I'd certainly like to see these articles get another airing. Barry, if I can help with it, let me know.

Jim




Jim,

If Barry is willing to send me copies of these articles I can have them
reprinted in the JSSUS newsletter. There is no copyright issue because of
their age.

I don't have his e-mail so I am sending this message to you.

Thanks,
Dale Garbutt
410-347-8710

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
Jim,

If Barry is willing to send me copies of these articles I can have them
reprinted in the JSSUS newsletter. There is no copyright issue because of
their age.

I don't have his e-mail so I am sending this message to you.

Thanks,
Dale Garbutt
410-347-8710

-----Original Message-----
From: Jim Gilbert [mailto:jggilbert@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 20, 2003 3:42 PM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Joly, Boxer, Mosle


Barry Thomas sent along some information on several interesting articles he
turned up in his files:

1. Inscriptions on Japanese Sword Fittings,
by Henri L. Joly.
Japan Society: TRANSACTIONS, VOL. XV,
pps 86 - 117 with 6 plates and a Table of kakihan.

2. European Influence on Japanese Sword Fittings, 1543 - 1853
by C.R. Boxer.
Japan Society: TRANSACTIONS, VOL. XXVIII,
pps 151 - 178 with 15 plates.

3. The Sword Ornaments of the Goto Shirobei Family,
by Alexander G. Mosle, M.J.S.m Imperial Japanese ..... (Consul??).
Japan Society: TRANSACTIONS, VOL. VIII,
pps 188 - 208 with a few plates and figures AND a genealogical
table of the pupils of the Goto Shirobei Family.

Have any of these appeared in print recently? Seems like a worthwhile
project to make them available on line (Barry's idea).

Jim

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Joly, Boxer, Mosle
messages.msgSnippet: Jim - I m not aware of any of these being published anywhere recently. It would be nice to read/see the articles, but it would IMHO be a huge task to code them
messages.messageBody:
Jim -

I'm not aware of any of these being published anywhere
recently. It would be nice to read/see the articles, but
it would IMHO be a huge task to code them all for the
web. Not to mention the webspace and download bandwidth
needed.

Rich
